path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Verichains_Lab/Verichains Public Audit Report - Blockcelerate Drep - v1.0.pdf

findings.title: No security issues found
findings.description: The assessment identified no security issues in DREP smart contracts code.

findings.title: Modifiable crowdsale parameters after sale start
findings.description: Many important parameters of the crowdsale rounds, such as start and stop times, rates, caps are modifiable after the sale has started.

findings.title: Token burn function does not emit event
findings.description: All balance changes should be able to tracked by emitting an event.

findings.title: A04._emit_ keyword compatibility issue with compiler version
findings.description: _emit_ keyword is only supported from compiler version 0.4.21, please change the contract code pragma version accordingly.

findings.title: A05.Insecure usage of modifiers and functions without documentation
findings.description: DREP should add documents for all modifiers and functions to ensure its correct usage.

findings.title: Potential issues with combined crowdsale contract instances
findings.description: Using a single contract instance for all sale rounds can lead to potential issues due to messed up of initialized sales parameters.
